text: Võ Chí Công (born Võ Toàn; 7 August 1912 – 8 September 2011) was a Vietnamese politician, a founding member of the Viet Cong and former President of Vietnam."Notice of Death of Võ Chí Công" Viet Nam News. September 9, 2011; retrieved 2011-10-23. ==Early life== In 1912, Công was born Võ Toàn in Quảng Nam Province, Vietnam, in 1912. "Vo Chi Cong, Vietnamese Leader, Is Dead at 99," New York Times (US). September 15, 2011; retrieved 2011-10-23. ==Career== In 1930, he first became active in politics. "State funeral held for former President Vo Chi Cong," Baomoi (Vietnam). September 13, 2011; retrieved 2011-10-23. In 1935, he joined the Communist Party of Indochina; and he rose through the ranks of the party. "Ex-Vietnam President Cong dies at 99," 'Hindustan Times (India). September 9, 2011; retrieved 2011-10-23. From 1987 through 1992, he was the Chairman of the Council of State of Vietnam which was like the current office of the President of Vietnam. ==Death== Công died in Ho Chi Minh City on 8 September 2011, aged 99. His state funeral was broadcast on television. ==References== Category:1912 births Category:2011 deaths Category:Presidents of Vietnam Category:Viet Cong
title: Võ Chí Công
